definition: curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)
to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before

sentences.english: Later, as night fell over the tumultuous capital, gunfire could be heard in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 隨後，夜幕降臨騷亂的首都，遠處傳來槍聲。

sentences.english: So when darkness came, we walked slowly and soundlessly to the Midianites’ camp.
sentences.chinese: 於是當夜幕降臨，我們悄悄的緩緩接近敵人的營地。

sentences.english: Nightfall found him many miles short of his destination.
sentences.chinese: 當夜幕降臨是，他離目的地還有好幾英里呢。
夜幕降臨，黑暗翩然而至。

sentences.english: So when darkness came, we walked slowly and soundlessly to the Midianites' camp.
sentences.chinese: 於是當夜幕降臨，我們悄悄的緩緩接近敵人的營地。

sentences.english: The night sky was unwilling to remain out of the limelight, the crescent moon.
sentences.chinese: 夜幕降臨，天空露出不甘寂寞的月牙。

sentences.english: And darkness falls in my eyes, and days are far from rosy now.
sentences.chinese: 當夜幕降臨，白天失去玫瑰的美麗顏色的時候。

sentences.english: Night lowered its curtain and mantled the land.
SunKangWhen night fell, Fuyang to light up.
sentences.chinese: 每當夜幕降臨，富陽就亮起來了。

sentences.english: During the night, the older brother began to pour his rice into his younger brother's barrel.
sentences.chinese: 當夜幕降臨，大哥開始將他的大米往小弟的桶裏倒。

sentences.english: Night falls and a fierce knocking assails your quiet home.
sentences.chinese: 夜幕降臨，一陣急促的敲門聲打破了家裏的沉靜。

sentences.english: When the darkness falls will you give him courage to walk.
sentences.chinese: 當夜幕降臨，你能不能讓他用勇氣戰勝黑暗。

sentences.english: As the evening beckons, they start making ice.
sentences.chinese: 當夜幕降臨的時候，這些空調設備就開始製冰。

sentences.english: Evening settles in over Emerald Lake in Yoho National Park.
sentences.chinese: 夜幕降臨在育空國家公園的翡翠湖上。

sentences.english: All three of them returned to the tent when darkness fell, and Harry took first watch.
sentences.chinese: 夜幕降臨，三人一起回到了帳篷裏，哈利值第一班。

definition: (of a city etc) ablaze with lights
lit. a boiling cauldron of voices (idiom)/hubbub/brouhaha
lit. to drop from the sky (idiom)/fig. to appear unexpectedly/to arise abruptly/out of the blue/to drop into one's lap
bored to death (idiom)/bored stiff/overcome with boredom
the Lantern Festival (15th of first month of lunar calendar)
not a sound to be heard (idiom)
